ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: NAME= <libref.>member-name <access-option(s)> ] 
      
Specifies the name of a new or existing document and its access mode.

[Syntax: LABEL= 'label'] 
      
Assigns a label to a document.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TO path] 
          
Points to a copy destination path.

[Syntax: AFTER= path] 
          
Inserts a copy of an entry after the specified path.

[Syntax: BEFORE= path] 
          
Inserts a copy of an entry before the specified path.
Inserts a copy of an entry at the beginning of the specified path.
Inserts a copy of an entry at the beginning of the specified path.

[Syntax: LEVELS= ALL | value] 
          
Specifies the number of levels below the specified path that you want to copy. 
This option is valid only if you specify a directory.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies all levels of the path.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Replace <value> with the numeric value of the path level.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: LEVELS= ALL | value] 
          
Specifies the level of the path that you want to delete. This option is valid only 
if you specify a directory.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies all levels of the path.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Replace <value> with the numeric value of the path level.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DIR <path>;] 
      
Sets or displays the current file location.

Syntax: DOC <options <access-option(s)>>;
      
Opens a document and its contents to browse or edit

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: LABEL= 'label] 
          
Assigns a label to a document.

[Syntax: LIBRARY=library-name] 
          
Specifies that only the documents in the specified library-name are listed.

[Syntax: NAME= libref.member-name <access-option(s)>] 
          
Specifies the name that you assign to a document and its access mode.
Closes the current document.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: HIDE path <, path-2, ...path-n
      
Prevents output from being displayed when the document is replayed.

Syntax: IMPORT DATA= data-set-name<data-set-option(s)>| GRSEG=grseg TO path </ option(s)>;
      
Imports the specified SAS data set or graph segment to the current file location.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DATA= data-set-name] 
          
Specifies an existing SAS data set that you want to import.

[Syntax: GRSEG=grseg] 
          
Stores a reference to a graph segment. 
          
  grseg 
  specifies the 3-level catalog path name. For example, GRSEG=SASUSER.grseg.mygraph.

  path 
  specifies the location where you want to import the data set or graph segment.

[Syntax: TO path] 
          
Points to an import destination path.

[Syntax: AFTER= path] 
          
Imports the data set or graph segment into the file location after the specified path.

[Syntax: BEFORE= path] 
          
Imports the data set or graph segment into the file location before the specified path.
Imports the data set or graph segment at the beginning of the file location.
Imports the data set or graph segment at the end the file location.

[Syntax: TEXTFILE= <filename | fileref>] 
          
Imports a text file into an ODS document that can be replayed to open ODS destinations. 

filename 
  specifies the filename. filename can be a listing file, a SAS program, or any other text file. 
  Requirement:filename must be enclosed in quotation marks. 

fileref 
  is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement 
  to assign a fileref.

[Syntax: TO path] 
          
Points to a link path.

[Syntax: AFTER= path] 
          
Links to the entry that follows the specified path in the current file location.

[Syntax: BEFORE= path] 
          
Links to the entry that precedes the specified path in the current file location.
Links to the first entry in the current file location
Links to the last entry in the current file location
Specifies a type of link that refers to a copy of an output object within the ODS document.
Copies the source label to the link.

Creates, in the entry list, columns for BY variables. The name of the BY variable 
becomes the column name. The values of the BY variables are listed in the columns. 

Note: When you specify the BYGROUPS option, only entries containing BY group information are listed. 

Interaction:It is recommended that when you specify the BYGROUPS option, specify the LEVELS=ALL 
option also. If the LEVELS=ALL option is not specified, then ODS cannot find BY group information 
within all levels of the directories.
Specifies the properties of the entries.
Resolves all links and lists the contents of the entries.

[Syntax: LEVELS= ALL | value] 
          
Specifies the level of the path that you want to list. This option is valid only 
if you specify a directory.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies all levels of the path.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Replace <value> with the numeric value of the path level.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the order in which the entries are listed.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Lists the entries in alphabetical order.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Lists the file locations in ascending order based on the date and time the files were created
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Lists the file locations in the order in which you arranged the entries

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: MAKE path <, path-2, ...path-n> </ option(s)>;
      
Creates one or more new file locations.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: AFTER= path] 
          
Adds the newly created file location after the specified path in the current file location.

[Syntax: BEFORE= path] 
          
Adds the newly created file location before the specified path in the current 
file location.
Adds the newly created file location to the beginning of the current file location.
Adds the newly created file location to the end of the current file location.

[Syntax: TO path] 
          
Points to a copy destination path.

[Syntax: AFTER= path] 
          
Moves the entry after the specified entry in the path.

[Syntax: BEFORE= path] 
          
Moves the entry before the specified entry in the path.
Moves the entry to the beginning of the specified file location.
Moves the entry to the end of the specified file location.

[Syntax: LEVELS= ALL | value] 
          
Specifies the level of the path that you want to move. This option is valid only 
if you specify a directory.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies all levels of the path.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Replace <value> with the numeric value of the path level.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: NOTE path <'text'> </ option(s)>;  
      
Creates text strings in the current file location.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: AFTER= path] 
          
Inserts the text string after the specified path.

[Syntax: BEFORE= path] 
          
Inserts the text string before the specified path.
Inserts the text string at the beginning of the path.
Specifies the alignment of the text string.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Aligns the text string with the left margin.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Centers the text string between the left and right margins.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Aligns the text string with the right margin

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Inserts the text string at the end of the path.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: OBANOTE<n> output-object <'text'> </ JUST= LEFT | CENTER | RIGHT>;  
      
Creates or modifies an object footer (lines of text) after the specified output object.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the alignment of the object footer.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Aligns the text string with the left margin.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Centers the text string between the left and right margins.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Aligns the text string with the right margin

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that a table containing the output object’s heading will be written 
to active destinations.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: OBBNOTE<n> output-object <'text'> </ JUST= LEFT | CENTER | RIGHT>;  
      
Creates or modifies an object heading (lines of text) before the output object.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the alignment of the object heading.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Aligns the text string with the left margin.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Centers the text string between the left and right margins.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Aligns the text string with the right margin

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that a table containing the output object’s footers will be written 
to active destinations.

Specifies that a table containing the output object’s footnotes will be written 
to active destinations.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: OBPAGE output-object< / <DELETE > <AFTER>>;
      
Creates or deletes a page break for an output object.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Inserts a page break after an output object.
Removes the page break for an output object.

StatementHelp.#cdata: Syntax: OBSTITLE<n> output-object <'text'> </ JUST= LEFT | CENTER | RIGHT>;

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the alignment of the text string.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Aligns the text string with the left margin.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Centers the text string between the left and right margins.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Aligns the text string with the right margin

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that a table containing the output object’s subtitles will be written 
to active destinations.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: OBTITLE<n> output-object <'text>;
      
Creates or modifies title lines for the output.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that a table containing the output object’s titles will be written to 
active destinations.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: RENAME path-1 TO path-2;
      
Assigns a different name to a file location or output object.

Syntax: REPLAY path<(where-expression)> <, path-2<(where-expression-2)>> 
  <, ...path-n<(where-expression-n)>> </ option(s)>; 

Displays one or more entries to the specified open ODS destination(s).

Arguments:
path 
  specifies the location of an entry. An entry can be one or more directories, links, or output objects. 
  Requirement:Separate multiple paths with commas. 
  Tip:You can use the symbol '^' to represent the current directory and the symbol '^^' 
    to represent the parent directory. 

(WHERE=(where-expression-1<operator >)) 
  conditionally selects a subset of entries in an ODS document. 

  where-expression 
    is an arithmetic or logical expression that consists of a sequence of operators and operands. 
  operand 
    is one of the following:

    constant 
      is a fixed value such as a date literal, a value, or a BY variable value. 
    SAS function      
    subsetting variable 
      is a special type of WHERE expression operand used by the DOCUMENT procedure to help you find 
      common values in ODS documents. Here are the subsetting variables: 
        _CDATE_ is the creation date of the current entry.         
        _CDATETIME_ is the creation datetime of the current entry.         
        _CTIME_ is the creation time of the current entry.        
        _LABEL_ is the label of the current entry. 
        _LABELPATH_ is the path to the label of the current entry. Document label paths are formed 
          by concatenating the labels and sequence numbers, and then separating them with the forward 
          slash (/) symbol. Document label paths are similar to the label paths specified by the ODS TRACE statement.         
        _MAX_ is the last observation.        
        _MDATE_ is the modification date of the current entry.         
        _MDATETIME_ is the modification datetime of the current entry.        
        _MIN_ is the first observation. _MIN_ is always set to 1
        _MTIME_ is the modification time of the current entry.         
        _NAME_ is the name of the current entry.        
        _OBS_ is the current observation number in an output object.         
        _OBS_ is used only on the REPLAY statement.
        observation-number is the observation number to be replayed.         
        observation-variable is the name of an observation.       
        _PATH_ is the path of the current entry.         
        _SEQNO_ is the sequence number of the current entry.         
        _TYPE_ is the type of the current entry.         
        variable- name is the name of a BY variable. 
       
      operator 
        compares one variable with a value or another variable. operator can be AND, 
        OR NOT, OR, AND NOT, or a comparison operator.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that footnotes that are active in a SAS session will override the footnotes 
that are stored in an ODS document.

Specifies that titles that are active in a SAS session will override the titles that 
are stored in an ODS document.

[Syntax: DEST= (ODS-destination(s))] 
          
Specifies one or more ODS destinations to display the output objects.

[Syntax: LEVELS= ALL | value] 
          
Specifies the level of the path that you want to replay. This option is valid only 
if you specify a directory.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies all levels of the path.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Replace <value> with the numeric value of the path level.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SETLABEL path 'label';] 
      
Assigns a label to the specified path.

[Syntax: UNHIDE path <, path-2, ...path-n>;] 
      
Enables the output of a hidden entry to be displayed when it is replayed.
